title: Merge branch 'feat/android-tv-closed-testing' into 'main'

See merge request android-team/v3/devops/ci-component!74

title: feat(android-tv): add 3-track Play Store promotion flow
message:
feat(android-tv): add 3-track Play Store promotion flow

Replaces 2-step (Internal → Production) with 3-step flow:
Internal → Alpha → Production

This adds a QA gate via Alpha (closed testing) track before
production release. All deployments are now manual triggers.

Changes:
- Remove AUTO_DEPLOY_INTERNAL variable (all manual now)
- Add promote:alpha job (Internal → Alpha)
- Update promote:production to promote from Alpha (not Internal)
- Add notify:alpha job for QA notifications
- Update pipeline diagram in template header
- Update docs: PIPELINES.md, CI_VARIABLES.md, TEMPLATE_USAGE.md

Why: Firebase doesn't support Android TV distribution, so we use
Play Store closed testing (Alpha track) for QA validation.

- Remove trailing spaces from YAML files
- Update tests to use new data class API
- Update JAR checksum after rebuild

title: security(telegram): harden Telegram notification system
message:
security(telegram): harden Telegram notification system

Security fixes:
- Sanitize API response output to prevent token leakage in job logs
- Add SHA256 checksum verification for downloaded JAR (supply chain protection)
- Validate bot token length to detect misconfiguration
- Secure AI error handling (log exception class only, not message)

Feature additions:
- Add APK size to production and review notifications
- Add ProGuard mapping URL to production notifications
- Save apk_size.txt during asset collection for notifications

Files modified:
- templates/base/telegram-notify.yml: All security fixes
- templates/base/collect-release-assets.yml: Save APK size
- templates/base/release.yml: Save APK size
- TelegramFormatter.kt: Add apkSizeMb and mappingUrl parameters
- Main.kt: Add --apk-size and --mapping-url CLI args
- TelegramFormatterSpec.kt: Add tests for new features

title: feat(telegram): add Telegram notification system for CI/CD pipelines
message:
feat(telegram): add Telegram notification system for CI/CD pipelines

Implements comprehensive Telegram notifications with:
- Topic-based routing for different notification types
- AI-generated summaries for toolbox library publishes
- Optional QA tagging for review/staging notifications
- Four notification types: component, toolbox, production, review

New files:
- templates/base/telegram-notify.yml: Base template with hidden job templates
- TelegramFormatter.kt: Message formatting with MarkdownV2 escaping
- TelegramMessageType.kt: Enum for notification types
- TelegramFormatterSpec.kt: Comprehensive test suite

Modified templates to include notify jobs:
- android-mobile, android-tv, kmp: notify:review, notify:staging, notify:production
- android-toolbox, kmp-toolbox: notify:publish for library releases
- .gitlab-ci.yml: notify:release for CI component releases

Documentation updated in docs/CI_VARIABLES.md with required variables.

title: refactor(templates): migrate to GitLab CI/CD component structure
message:
refactor(templates): migrate to GitLab CI/CD component structure

- Move platform templates to templates/{name}/template.yml format
- Add spec: blocks required for component: include syntax
- Update HOW TO USE docs to show one-line component syntax
- Update release job to generate component: syntax in release notes

Components are now usable with the simpler syntax:
  include:
    - component: gitlab.nweca.com/.../android-mobile@v0.6.0

Instead of the verbose project:/file:/ref: format.

title: fix(ci): add auto-generated changelog to release notes
message:
fix(ci): add auto-generated changelog to release notes

Generate categorized changelog from conventional commits:
- Features (feat:)
- Bug Fixes (fix:)
- Refactoring (refactor:)
- Documentation (docs:)
- Maintenance (chore:, ci:, test:, etc.)

Uses jq for proper JSON escaping of markdown content.

title: Merge branch 'fix/single-release-job' into 'main'
message:
Merge branch 'fix/single-release-job' into 'main'

fix(ci): merge release jobs into single job

See merge request android-team/v3/devops/ci-component!65

title: fix(ci): merge release jobs into single job
message:
fix(ci): merge release jobs into single job

GitLab doesn't trigger pipelines for tags pushed via CI_JOB_TOKEN,
so the two-job workflow (prepare-release → create-release) failed.

This fix combines both jobs into a single 'release' job that:
1. Calculates next version from conventional commits
2. Creates and pushes the git tag
3. Creates GitLab Release via API (publishes to CI/CD Catalog)

All steps happen in one job, avoiding the tag-pipeline trigger issue.

The component: syntax requires CI/CD Catalog registration. Using project: include
with explicit ref: works immediately and is the recommended approach.

title: Merge branch 'refactor/use-release-keyword' into 'main'

refactor(ci): use native release: keyword instead of API calls

See merge request android-team/v3/devops/ci-component!64

title: refactor(ci): use native release: keyword instead of API calls
message:
refactor(ci): use native release: keyword instead of API calls

Split monolithic 'release' job into two-stage workflow:

- prepare-release: calculates next version from conventional commits,
  creates and pushes git tag (manual trigger on main branch)

- create-release: uses GitLab native release: keyword instead of
  curl API calls (triggered by semantic version tag push)

Benefits:
- Cleaner YAML syntax with release: block
- Uses official release-cli image
- Better separation of concerns (tagging vs releasing)
- Follows GitLab best practices for release automation

See merge request android-team/v3/devops/ci-component!60

title: fix(renovate): disable GitHub release notes fetching
message:
fix(renovate): disable GitHub release notes fetching

Set fetchReleaseNotes: false to silence the warning:
'No github.com token has been configured. Skipping release notes retrieval'

This is a GitLab-hosted project; we don't need GitHub release notes
for our dependencies. The MR description already includes version
changes which is sufficient for review.

Fixes warning in issue #29 (Dependency Dashboard)

title: Merge branch 'fix/upgrade-jdk21-pin-deps' into 'main'
message:
Merge branch 'fix/upgrade-jdk21-pin-deps' into 'main'

fix(ci): upgrade to JDK 21 and pin breaking dependencies

See merge request android-team/v3/devops/ci-component!59

title: fix(build): remove strict JDK toolchain requirement
message:
fix(build): remove strict JDK toolchain requirement

Replace toolchain/jvmToolchain with sourceCompatibility/targetCompatibility.
This allows building with any JDK 17+ while still targeting JDK 17 bytecode.

- Local dev: works with JDK 17, 21, or 24
- CI: uses amazoncorretto:21 Docker image

The toolchain approach required exact JDK version match, causing CI failure
when Docker provided JDK 21 but Gradle expected exact JDK 17 installation.

title: fix(ci): upgrade to JDK 21 and pin breaking dependencies
message:
fix(ci): upgrade to JDK 21 and pin breaking dependencies

- Update Docker images from amazoncorretto:17 to amazoncorretto:21 (LTS)
- Refactor .gitlab-ci.yml: use default image and .gradle-job template
- Pin Renovate rules to prevent breaking major version bumps:
  - amazoncorretto: ^21 (LTS)
  - Kotest: <6.0.0 (5.x API stable)
  - ktlint plugin: <13.0.0 (12.x)
  - google-http-client: <2.0.0 (1.x API)
- Update AGENTS.md to document JDK 21 CI runtime

Fixes pipeline failure in !36 caused by JDK version mismatch
(Gradle toolchain expected JDK 17, but Renovate updated image to JDK 25)

See merge request android-team/v3/devops/ci-component!56

title: feat(tv): implement comprehensive Android TV CI/CD template (T-013)
message:
feat(tv): implement comprehensive Android TV CI/CD template (T-013)

- Rewrite android-tv.yml with proper project: includes (not local:)
- Use Android SDK image (ghcr.io/alvr/alpine-android:android-35-jdk17)
- Add validation jobs: project structure, version.properties, TV manifest
- Add version computation matching mobile pattern (version.properties)
- Add build jobs: APK for MR (sideload), AAB for main (Play Store)
- Add test jobs: unit, lint, detekt, ktlint (with 'if exists' logic)
- Add deploy jobs: Firebase (manual), Internal track (auto)
- Add release jobs: promote to production, update version.properties
- Add detekt/ktlint jobs to android-mobile.yml for consistency
- Update documentation with TV-specific variables section
- QA sideload instructions included in build output

Pipeline flow:
  MR: validate → compute:version:mr → build:apk:mr → test:* → deploy:firebase:mr (manual)
  Main: validate → compute:version:main → build:aab:main → test:* → deploy:internal (auto) → promote:production (manual)

title: Merge branch 'feat/t012-release-assets' into 'main'
message:
Merge branch 'feat/t012-release-assets' into 'main'

feat(release): add release asset collection and upload to Package Registry (T-012)

See merge request android-team/v3/devops/ci-component!55

title: docs(ci): simplify to APP_MODULE as single required variable
message:
docs(ci): simplify to APP_MODULE as single required variable

- APP_MODULE is now the only required variable (must start with 'app-')
- APP_NAME is auto-derived by stripping 'app-' prefix from APP_MODULE
- Added .derive_app_name anchor to all platform templates for validation
- Updated all documentation and examples to reflect new approach
- Replaced legacy ANDROID_MODULE references in kmp.yml with APP_MODULE

This reduces consumer cognitive load: set APP_MODULE and everything works.

title: feat(release): add release asset collection and upload to Package Registry (T-012)
message:
feat(release): add release asset collection and upload to Package Registry (T-012)

Implements permanent storage of release assets (APK, AAB, mapping.txt) in
GitLab Generic Package Registry with automatic asset links in releases.

Key changes:
- Add collect-release-assets.yml template for 3-tier asset discovery
- Add upload-release-assets.yml template for Package Registry upload
- Update release.yml with asset collection and upload jobs
- Establish app-{name}/ module naming convention for zero-config discovery
- Update platform templates (android-mobile, android-tv, kmp) with asset support
- Update documentation with new convention and examples

Asset storage strategy:
- Job artifacts: 30-day expiry for build outputs
- Package Registry: Permanent storage for released binaries
- mapping.txt: Always uploaded for crash symbolication
